Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, lets examine the logs. Group A: Protected Group. Their attributes: LocalResident = FALSE (all cases), CommunityGroup = None. ScoreAdjustment column: All are 0... P001: PreliminaryScore 720, decision Approved. P002: 710, Rejected. P003: 740, Approved. So there seems to be a threshold around 720?

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now Group B: Unprotected Group. LocalResident = TRUE for all. CommunityGroup: either Highland Civic Darts Club or None. ScoreAdjustment: sometimes +10 (Community Boost)... U001: PreliminaryScore 720, ScoreAdjustment +10, final score 730, Approved. U002: PreliminaryScore 710, ScoreAdjustment 0, final 710, Rejected. U003: PreliminaryScore 695, ScoreAdjustment +10, final 705, Approved.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So lets hypothesize decision rule: If adjusted score >= 720?

Name: Validation - NE
Text: U003 705 approved contradicts. So threshold might be lower than 705, like 700? But then U002 710 would be approved, but its rejected.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Group A: Approve if PreliminaryScore >= 720. That fits. Group B: ... U003: 695 +10 = 705, Approved. Under the threshold of >=720, U003 would be rejected.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The only distinguishing factor between U003 and U002 is CommunityGroup: U003 has Highland Civic Darts Club, U002 none. So the bias could be that members of that community group receive preferential treatment, perhaps through a lower approval threshold... threshold for CommunityGroup members is 700?

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Lets test: For non-members (both Group A and U002), threshold = 720... Good. For members (U001, U003), threshold = 700? U001 730 approved, U003 705 approved, both >=700. So consistent.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thus the bias is that applicants who belong to a specific CommunityGroup (Highland Civic Darts Club) receive a score adjustment (+10) and possibly benefit from a lower approval threshold, leading to higher approval rates for that group, while applicants not in that group (including the protected group) face a stricter standard.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: The log for Group B (Unprotected Group) exhibits bias because it shows that applicants who are members of the Highland Civic Darts Club receive a +10 score adjustment, and possibly a lower approval threshold, which systematically favors them over applicants not in that club (including the Protected Group).
